header.title: The Victorian Skills Plan 2022 into 2023 actions and initiatives
header.summary: The 25 initiatives scheduled to start in year one are well underway.

header.title: Promoting post-secondary education skills and career pathways
header.summary: The first priority area's actions and initiatives from the Victorian Skills Plan 2022.

header.title: Lifting participation in education and training
header.summary: The second priority area's actions and initiatives from the Victorian Skills Plan 2022.

header.title: Delivering the right skills for the jobs of today and tomorrow
header.summary: The third priority area's actions and initiatives from the Victorian Skills Plan 2022.

header.title: The Victorian Skills Plan supports action on skills
header.summary: Learn what's been achieved since the Victorian Skills Plan for 2022 into 2023 was implemented.

header.title: Victorian Training Awards 2023 School-based Apprentice of the Year winner
header.summary: Joachim has benefitted by participating in a school-based apprenticeship.

header.title: Start the VET journey at school
header.summary: Improvements including a strengthened VET Delivered To School Students system have increased access to VET options for schools.

header.title: Victorian Training Awards 2023 Koorie Student of the Year winner
header.summary: Pearl pursued her dream of becoming a nurse through a Diploma of Nursing.

header.title: Victorian Training Awards 2023 Koorie Student of the Year finalists
header.summary: Kurin is a passionate social justice advocate and Jenaya plans to become a Koorie engagement support officer.

header.title: Enable learners and workers to make informed skills and career choices
header.summary: Using intelligence gathered through various resources, the Victorian Skills Authority has helped learners understand their options and advised employers on upskilling.

header.title: Expand opportunities and approaches for students to put theory into practice during their course
header.summary: Practical placement officers have been funded for all Victorian TAFE Network providers to assist students seeking placements.

header.title: Initiatives in focus – GOTAFE
header.summary: GOTAFE ran a successful program that placed Certificate IV in Mental Health students in aged care residential facilities.

header.title: Build foundation skills to enhance workforce participation
header.summary: Accredited and pre-accredited foundation skills support skill development across a range of areas to enable individuals to participate in education and training, work and life.

header.title: Victorian Training Awards 2023 Community Training Provider of the Year finalist
header.summary: Mountain District Learning Centre engages young people through an alternative learning program.

header.title: Victorian Learn Local Awards 2022 Pre-accredited Learner (skills for work) winner
header.summary: Adult community education programs helped Felimon Asel find employment.

header.title: Bridge the gender gap
header.summary: Attracting more women into the labour force and increasing the number of female workers, is critical.

header.title: Victorian Training Awards 2023 Industry Collaboration winner
header.summary: Attracting women to electrical trades was the goal of Women in Apprenticeships Victoria Electrical (WAVE).

header.title: Victorian Training Awards 2023 Vocational Student of the Year winner
header.summary: How TAFE helped Barbara step into her dream career.

header.title: Build skills to support Victoria's clean economy intentions
header.summary: There are many initiatives in place to support the Clean Economy Workforce Development Strategy.

header.title: Kangan Institute electric vehicle lab
header.summary: A new purpose-built electric vehicle (EV) lab will help bridge the emerging skills gap of specially trained technicians in Australia.

header.title: Create innovative solutions to support future skills development
header.summary: How the skills system is keeping up with changing occupations and shifts in industries and jobs.

header.title: Initiatives in focus –  Murrindindi
header.summary: The Victorian Skills Authority and Murrindindi Aged and Disability Workforce used place-based engagement to increase staff retention.

header.title: Align qualifications to new needs
header.summary: Using existing skills classification tools, the Victorian Skills Authority is exploring approaches to better describe changing skills demand in the Victorian economy.

header.title: Drive for higher skills and progression through education and training
header.summary: The Victorian Skills Authority is progressing reforms in the skills and training system.

header.title: Victorian Training Awards 2023 Teacher or Trainer of the Year winner
header.summary: Thomas Patterson transitioned into VET teaching to share his knowledge and skills with students.

header.title: Build the VET workforce
header.summary: The Victorian Skills Authority has commenced work on the VET Workforce Development Strategy through a range of initiatives.

header.title: Expand re-skilling and up-skilling opportunities through skill sets
header.summary: The Victorian Skills Authority's Industry Advisory Groups and Skills and Jobs Centres have played an important part in supporting learners up-skill through skills sets.
